answers.answer: Typically, you would like the fasting glucose to be under 100.  Prednisone can raise the sugar levels transiently.I would consider repeating the tests in the few weeks.  If the glucose level is between 100-126, impaired glucose tolerance (i.e pre-diabetes) can be suspected - especially if diabetes already runs in your family.  Increasing exercise and weight loss will help with this.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.Medical Weblog:kevinmd_b
